title: fix: add SSE support for api.airforce video models + disable grok-video
author: voodoohop

gist.headline: Tuning the video signal
gist.blurb: We've upgraded our video infrastructure with SSE streaming for better reliability. `grok-video` is taking a short nap while we wait for upstream stability to improve.
gist.summary: Added Server-Sent Events (SSE) support for api.airforce video models to fix empty responses, while temporarily disabling the unstable `grok-video` model.
gist.impact: Video generation infrastructure is now more robust, though `grok-video` is temporarily unavailable to prevent error rates.
gist.visual_concept: Bee mascot as a broadcast engineer fixing a retro video feed. Connecting cables to ensure the stream flows.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the 8-bit bee mascot acting as a broadcast engineer, plugging a cable into a retro CRT monitor tower. Cozy 8-bit pixel art aesthetic. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Cute bee character with chunky retro sprites. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley or A Short Hike. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
